member.summary: Look up the string name of a color with respect to the screen associated with the specified colormap. It returns both the exact color values and the closest values provided by the screen with respect to the visual type of the specified colormap. The pixel value is returned in x11colorScrDef.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to use.
The color's name to look up.
The exact color.
The nearest color provided by the hardware.
member.returns: Nonzero if the name is resolved, or it returns zero otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XFreeColors(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TPixel[],X11.TInt,X11.TUlong)
member.summary: Free the cells represented by pixels whose values are in the pixels array. The planes argument should not have any bits set to 1 in common with any of the pixels. The set of all pixels is produced by ORing together subsets of the planes argument with the pixels. The request frees all of these pixels that were allocated by the client (using XAllocColor(), XAllocNamedColor(), XAllocColorCells(), and XAllocColorPlanes()).
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to use for color cell deallocation.
The [] of pixel values that map to the cells in the specified colormap to free.
The number of colors to free.
The planes to free.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XAllocColorCells(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TBoolean,X11.TUlong[]@,X11.TUint,X11.TUlong[]@,X11.TUint)
member.summary: Allocates read/write color cells.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to allocate color cells for.
The value that indicates whether the planes must be contiguous.
Returns an [] array of plane masks.
The number of plane masks that are to be returned in the plane masks array.
Returns an [] array of pixel values.
The number of pixel values that are to be returned in the pixels_return array.
member.returns: Returns nonzero on success, or zero otherwise.
member.remarks: If ncolors and nplanes are requested, then ncolors pixels and nplane plane masks are returned. No mask will have any bits set to 1 in common with any other mask or with any of the pixels. By ORing together each pixel with zero or more masks, ncolors * 2 pow(nplanes) distinct pixels can be produced. All of these are allocated writable by the request. For GrayScale or PseudoColor, each mask has exactly one bit set to 1. For DirectColor, each has exactly three bits set to 1. If contig is true and if all masks are ORed together, a single contiguous set of bits set to 1 will be formed for GrayScale or PseudoColor and three contiguous sets of bits set to 1 (one within each pixel subfield) for DirectColor. The RGB values of the allocated entries are undefined.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XAllocExactNamedColor(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Allocate a read-only colormap entry corresponding to the exact RGB value. XAllocExactColor() returns the pixel value of the exact color specified. The corresponding colormap cell is read-only. Multiple clients that request the same effective RGB value can be assigned the same read-only entry, thus allowing entries to be shared. When the last client deallocates a shared cell, it is deallocated.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to use.
The color's name to look up.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XAllocClosestNamedColor(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Allocate a read-only colormap entry corresponding to the closest RGB value supported by the hardware. XAllocExactColor() returns the pixel value of the closest color. The corresponding colormap cell is read-only. Multiple clients that request the same effective RGB value can be assigned the same read-only entry, thus allowing entries to be shared. When the last client deallocates a shared cell, it is deallocated.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to use.
The color's name to look up.
member.returns: The pixel value of the requested color on success, or 0 as fallback.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XAllocClosestNamedColor(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allocate a read-only colormap entry corresponding to the closest RGB value supported by the hardware. XAllocExactColor() returns the pixel value of the closest color. The corresponding colormap cell is read-only. Multiple clients that request the same effective RGB value can be assigned the same read-only entry, thus allowing entries to be shared. When the last client deallocates a shared cell, it is deallocated.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The colormap to use.
The color's name to look up.
Returns true, if requested color has been allocated exactls, of false otherwise.
member.returns: The pixel value of the requested color on success, or 0 as fallback.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XCreateImage(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TUint,X11.XImageFormat,X11.TInt,System.IntPtr,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Allocate the memory needed for an XImage structure for the specified display *** but *** does not allocate space for the image itself. Rather, it initializes the structure byte-order, bit-order, and bitmap-unit values from the display and returns a pointer to the XImage structure. The red, green, and blue mask values are defined for Z format images only and are derived from the Visual structure passed in. Other values also are passed in. The offset permits the rapid displaying of the image without requiring each scanline to be shifted into position.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The visual to store the image.
The (color) depth of the image.
The image format.
The number of pixels to ignore at the beginning of the scanline.
The [] image data. In other words, a char* / byte* to the image data array
The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
The quantum of a scanline (8, 16, or 32). In other words, the start of one scanline is separated in client memory from the start of the next scanline by an integer multiple of this many bits.
The number of bytes in the client image between the start of one scanline and the start of the next.
member.returns: The new XImage on success, or on any error.
member.remarks: If a value of zero is passed in bytesPerLine, Xlib assumes that the scanlines are contiguous in memory and calculates the value of bytesPerLine itself.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XCreatePixmap(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TUint)
member.summary: Create a pixmap of the width, height, and depth you specified and returns a pixmap ID that identifies it. It is valid to pass an InputOnly window to the drawable argument.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable, the pixmap is created on. The server uses the specified drawable to determine on which screen to create the pixmap.
The width, which define the dimensions of the pixmap.
The height, which define the dimensions of the pixmap.
The depth of the pixmap.
member.returns: The pixmap on success, or IntPtr.Zero otherwise.
member.remarks: The width and height arguments must be nonzero, or a BadValue error results. The depth argument must be one of the depths supported by the screen of the specified drawable, or a BadValue error results. The pixmap can be used only on this screen and only with other drawables of the same depth. The initial contents of the pixmap are undefined.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XFreePixmap(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Delete the association between the pixmap ID and the pixmap. Then, the X server frees the pixmap storage when there are no references to it. The pixmap should never be referenced again.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The pixmap to free.
member.remarks: The XFreePixmap() function first deletes the association between the pixmap ID and the pixmap. Then, the X server frees the pixmap storage when there are no references to it. The pixmap should never be referenced again.

member.summary: Set the clip origin in the specified GC. The clip-mask origin is interpreted relative to the origin of whatever destination drawable is specified in the graphics request.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XSetClipRectangles(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.XRectangle[],X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Change the clip-mask in the specified GC to the specified list of rectangles and sets the clip origin. The output is clipped to remain contained within the rectangles. The clip-origin is interpreted relative to the origin of whatever destination drawable is specified in a graphics request. The rectangle coordinates are interpreted relative to the clip-origin. The rectangles should be nonintersecting, or the graphics results will be undefined.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The grapchics context to apply the clip rectangles on.
The x-coordinate of the clip-mask origin.
The y-coordinate of the clip-mask origin.
The [] array of rectangles that define the clip-mask.
The number of rectangles.
The ordering relations on the rectangles. Any value of XClipRectanglesOrdering can be passed.
member.remarks: Note that the list of rectangles can be empty, which effectively disables output. This is the opposite of passing None as the clip-mask in XCreateGC, XChangeGC, and XSetClipMask.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XCopyArea(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Combine the specified rectangle of src with the specified rectangle of dest. The drawables must have the same root and depth.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
Specify the source rectangle to be combined.
Specify the source rectangle to be combined.
The grapchics context to apply the rectangle combination on.
Specify the x coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the source rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the y coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the source rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the width, which is the dimension of both the source and destination rectangles.
Specify the height, which is the dimension of both the source and destination rectangles.
Specify the x coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the destination rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the y coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the destination rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
member.remarks: If regions of the source rectangle are obscured and have not been retained in backing store or if regions outside the boundaries of the source drawable are specified, those regions are not copied. Instead, the following occurs on all corresponding destination regions that are either visible or are retained in backing store. * If the destination is a window with a background other than None, corresponding regions of the destination are tiled with that background (with plane-mask of all ones and GXcopy function). Regardless of tiling or whether the destination is a window or a pixmap, if graphics-exposures is true, then GraphicsExpose events for all corresponding destination regions are generated. * If graphics-exposures is true but no GraphicsExpose events are generated, a NoExpose event is generated. Note that by default graphics-exposures is True in new GCs. This function uses these GC components: function, plane-mask, subwindow-mode, graphics-exposure, clip-x-origin, clip-y-origin, and clip-mask.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XCopyPlane(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUlong)
member.summary: Modify the specified rectangle of dest unsing a single bit plane of the specified source rectangle combined with the specified GC. The drawables must have the same root but need not have the same depth. The plane must have exactly one bit set to 1 (that identifies the plane) and the value of plane must be less than 2 power(n), where n is the depth of src.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
Specify the source rectangle to be combined.
Specify the source rectangle to be combined.
The grapchics context to apply the rectangle combination on.
Specify the x coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the source rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the y coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the source rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the width, which is the dimension of both the source and destination rectangles.
Specify the height, which is the dimension of both the source and destination rectangles.
Specify the x coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the destination rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the y coordinate, which are relative to the origin of the destination rectangle and specify its upper-left corner.
Specify the index of the bit plane. You must set exactly one bit to 1.
member.remarks: Effectively, XCopyPlane() forms a pixmap of the same depth as the rectangle of dest and with a size specified by the source region. It uses the foreground/background pixels in the GC (foreground everywhere the bit plane in src contains a bit set to 1, background everywhere the bit plane in src contains a bit set to 0) and the equivalent of a CopyArea() protocol request is performed with all the same exposure semantics. This can also be thought of as using the specified region of the source bit plane as a stipple with a fill-style of FillOpaqueStippled for filling a rectangular area of the destination. This function uses these GC components: function, plane-mask, foreground, background, subwindow-mode, graphics-exposures, clip-x-origin, clip-y-origin, and clip-mask.

member.param: The image to overwrite a containing pixel.
The logical x coordinate of the pixel to overwrite.
The logical y coordinate of the pixel to overwrite.
The pixel value to overwrite.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XCreateBitmapFromData(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TUchar[],X11.TUint,X11.TUint)
member.summary: Allows to include a bitmap file into the program code that was written out by XWriteBitmapFile () without reading in the bitmap file.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable that indicates the screen.
The [] data in bitmap format.
The width of the bitmap.
The height of the bitmap.
member.returns: The server side pixmap on success, or null otherwise.
member.remarks: It is your responsibility to free the bitmap using XFreePixmap() when finished.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XReadBitmapFile(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TChar[],X11.TUint@,X11.TUint@,System.IntPtr@,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@)
member.summary: Read in a file containing a bitmap. The file is parsed in the encoding of the current locale. The ability to read other than the standard format is implementation dependent
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
Specify the drawable that indicates the screen.
Specify the file [] name to use. The format of the file name is operating-system dependent.
Return the width of the read in bitmap file.
Return the height of the read in bitmap file.
Returns the bitmap that is created.
Return the hotspot x coordinate.
Return the hotspot y coordinate.
member.returns: If the file cannot be opened, XReadBitmapFile() returns BitmapOpenFailed. If the file can be opened but does not contain valid bitmap data, it returns BitmapFileInvalid. If insufficient working storage is allocated, it returns BitmapNoMemory. If the file is readable and valid, it returns BitmapSuccess.
member.remarks: XReadBitmapFile() returns the bitmap's height and width, as read from the file, to widthReturn and heightReturn. It then creates a pixmap of the appropriate size, reads the bitmap data from the file into the pixmap, and assigns the pixmap to the caller's variable bitmapReturn. The caller must free the bitmap using XFreePixmap() when finished. If name_x_hot and name_y_hot exist (in the bitmap file), XReadBitmapFile() returns them to xHotReturn and yHotReturn; otherwise, it returns -1,-1.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XClearWindow(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Clear the entire area in the specified window and is equivalent to XClearArea(display, w, 0, 0, 0, 0, False). If the window has a defined background tile, the rectangle is tiled with a plane-mask of all ones and GXcopy function. If the window has background None, the contents of the window are not changed. If you specify a window whose class is InputOnly , a BadMatch error results.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The window to clear.

member.summary: Set the background of the window to the specified graphics context.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The window to set the background for.
The background to set.
member.remarks: XSetWindowBackground() uses a pixmap of undefined size filled with the pixel value you passed. If the background of an InputOnly window is changed, a BadMatch error results. The XSetBackground() does not change the current contents of the window.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XSetWindowBackgroundPixmap(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Set the background pixmap of the window to the specified pixmap.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The window to set the background pixmap.
The background pixmap, ParentRelative, or None.
member.remarks: The background pixmap can immediately be freed if no further explicit references to it are to be made. If ParentRelative is specified, the background pixmap of the window's parent is used, or on the root window, the default background is restored. If the background of an InputOnly window is changed, a BadMatch error results. If the background is set to None, the window has no defined background. A XSetWindowBackground () redefines the background. The XSetWindowBackgroundPixmap() does not change the current contents of the window.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XClearArea(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Paint a rectangular area in the specified window according to the specified dimensions with the window's background pixel or pixmap.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The window to paint the background for (and implicit the upper-left corner of the rectangle).
The x coordinate, which is relative to the origin of the window.
The y coordinate, which is relative to the origin of the window.
The width, which is the dimensions of the rectangle. If width is zero, it is replaced with the current width of the window minus x.
The height, which is the dimensions of the rectangle. If height is zero, it is replaced with the current height of the window minus y.
Determine whether 'Expose' events are to be generated.
member.remarks: The subwindow-mode effectively is ClipByChildren. If the window has a defined background tile, the rectangle clipped by any children is filled with this tile. If the window has background None, the contents of the window are not changed. In either case, if exposures is True, one or more Expose events are generated for regions of the rectangle that are either visible or are being retained in a backing store. If the area of an InputOnly window is cleared, a BadMatch error results.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XGetGCValues(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TUlong,X11.XGCValues@)
member.summary: The XGetGCValues() function returns the components specified by valuemask for the specified GC. If the valuemask contains a valid set of GC mask bits (GCFunction, GCPlaneMask, GCForeground, GCBackground, GCLineWidth, GCLineStyle, GCCapStyle, GCJoinStyle, GCFillStyle, GCFillRule, GCTile, GCStipple, GCTileStipXOrigin, GCTileStipYOrigin, GCFont, GCSubwindowMode, GCGraphicsExposures, GCClipXOrigin, GCCLipYOrigin, GCDashOffset, or GCArcMode) and no error occurs, XGetGCValues() sets the requested components in values and returns nonzero. Otherwise, it returns a zero status.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The crapchics context to get the values for.
The flags, determining which values to get.
The structure containing the investigated values.
member.returns: Nonzero on success, or zero otherwise.
member.remarks: Note that the clip-mask and dash-list (represented by the GCClipMask and GCDashList bits, respectively, in the valuemask) cannot be requested. Also note that an invalid resource ID (with one or more of the three most-significant bits set to 1) will be returned for GCFont, GCTile, and GCStipple if the component has never been explicitly set by the client.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XChangeGC(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TUlong,X11.XGCValues@)
member.summary: Change the components specified by valuemask for the specified GC. The values argument contains the values to be set. The values and restrictions are the same as for XCreateGC(). Changing the clip-mask overrides any previous XSetClipRectangles() request on the context. Changing the dash-offset or dash-list overrides any previous XSetDashes() request on the context. The order in which components are verified and altered is server-dependent. If an error is generated, a subset of the components may have been altered.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The crapchics context to change the values for.
The flags, determining which values to change.
The structure containing the change values.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib._XDrawArc(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Draw a single circular or elliptical arc specified by a bounding rectangle and two angles. The center of the circle or ellipse is the center of the rectangle, and the major and minor axes are specified by the width and height. Positive angles indicate counterclockwise motion, and negative angles indicate clockwise motion. If the magnitude of angle2 is greater than 360 degrees, XDrawArc() truncates it to 360 degrees. Specifying an arc with one endpoint and a clockwise extent draws the same pixels as specifying the other endpoint and an equivalent counterclockwise extent, except as it affects joins.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable to draw on.
The crapchics context to use for drawing.
The bounding box x-coordinate.
The bounding box y-coordinate.
The bounding box width.
The bounding box height.
The arc's start angle, relative to the 3 o clock position counterclockwise in units of degrees * 64.
The angle between startAngle and the end of the arc, counterclockwise in units of degrees * 64.
member.remarks: XDrawLine() use these GC components: function, plane-mask, line-width, line-style, cap-style, join-style, fill-style, subwindow-mode, clip-x-origin, clip-y-origin, and clip-mask. It also uses these GC mode-dependent components: foreground, background, tile, stipple, tile-stipple-x-origin, tile-stipple-y-origin, dash-offset, and dash-list.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib._XDrawLines(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.XPoint[],X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Draw numPoints-1 lines between each pair of points (point[i], point[i+1]) in the array of XPoint structure using the components of the specified GC. It draws the lines in the order listed in the array. The lines join correctly at all intermediate points, and if the first and last points coincide, the first and last lines also join correctly. For any given line, XDrawLines does not draw a pixel more than once. If thin (zero line-width) lines intersect, the intersecting pixels are drawn multiple times. If wide lines intersect, the intersecting pixels are drawn only once, as though the entire PolyLine protocol request were a single, filled shape.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable to draw on.
The grapchics context to use for drawing.
The [] array of points, defining the lines to draw.
The number of points in the array.

The coordinate mode. You can pass CoordModeOrigin or CoordModePrevious. CoordModeOrigin treats all coordinates as relative to the origin, and CoordModePrevious treats all coordinates after the first as relative to the previous point.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XFillPolygon(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.XPoint[],System.Int32,X11.XPolygonShape,X11.XCoordinateMode)
member.summary: Fill the region closed by the specified path. The path is closed automatically if the last point in the list does not coincide with the first point. XFillPolygon() does not draw a pixel of the region more than once. The fill-rule of the GC controls the filling behavior of self-intersecting polygons. This function uses these GC components: function, plane-mask, fill-style, fill-rule, subwindow-mode, clip-x-origin, clip-y-origin, and clip-mask. It also uses these GC mode-dependent components: foreground, background, tile, stipple, tile-stipple-x-origin, and tile-stipple-y-origin.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable to draw on.
The grapchics context to use for drawing.
The [] array of points, defining the polygon to fill.
The number of points in the array.

The shape complexity. You can pass Complex, Convex or Nonconvex. * Complex means the path may self-intersect. Note that contiguous coincident points in the path are not treated as self-intersection. * Convex means for every pair of points inside the polygon, the line segment connecting them does not intersect the path. If known by the client, specifying Convex can improve performance. If Convex is specified for a path that is not convex, the graphics results are undefined. * Nonconvex means the path does not self-intersect, but the shape is not wholly convex. If known by the client, specifying Nonconvex instead of Complex may improve performance. If Nonconvex is specified for a self-intersecting path, the graphics results are undefined.

The coordinate mode. You can pass CoordModeOrigin or CoordModePrevious. CoordModeOrigin treats all coordinates as relative to the origin, and CoordModePrevious treats all coordinates after the first as relative to the previous point.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XFillArc(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TInt,X11.TUint,X11.TUint,X11.TInt,X11.TInt)
member.summary: Fill region closed by the infinitely thin path described by the specified arc and, depending on the arc-mode specified in the GC, one (ArcChord) or two (ArcPieSlice) line segments. For ArcChord , the single line segment joining the endpoints of the arc is used. For ArcPieSlice , the two line segments joining the endpoints of the arc with the center point are used.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable to draw on.
The crapchics context to use for drawing.
The left top bounding rectangle x-coordinate.
The left top bounding rectangle y-coordinate.
The bounding rectangle width.
The bounding rectangle height.
The start of the arc relative to the three-o'clock position from the center, in units of degrees * 64.
The the path and extent of the arc relative to the start of the arc, in units of degrees * 64.
member.remarks: The function uses these GC components: : function, plane-mask, fill-style, arc-mode, subwindow-mode, clip-x-origin, clip-y-origin, and clip-mask. It also uses these GC mode-dependent components: foreground, background, tile, stipple, tile-stipple-x-origin, and tile-stipple-y-origin.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XSupportsLocale
member.summary: Check if Xlib functions are capable of operating under the current locale.
member.returns: True, if Xlib functions are capable of operating under the current locale, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: If it returns False, Xlib locale-dependent functions, for which the XLocaleNotSupported return status is defined, will return XLocaleNotSupported. Other Xlib locale-dependent routines will operate in the 'C' locale.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XSetLocaleModifiers(X11.TChar[])
member.summary: Set the X modifiers for the current locale setting.
member.param: The null-terminated [] string of the form '{@category=value}', that is, having zero or more concatenated '@category=value' entries, where category is a category name and value is the (possibly empty) setting for that category. The values are encoded in the current locale. Category names are restricted to the POSIX Portable Filename Character Set.
member.returns: The string reprecenting the current modifierrs on success (can be empty, if only implementation-dependent default modifiers are activated), or IntPtr.Zero if invalid values are given for one or more modifier categories and none of the current modifiers are changed.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XQueryTextExtents(System.IntPtr,X11.TInt,X11.TChar[],X11.TInt,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@,X11.XCharStruct@)
member.summary: Return the bounding box of the specified 8-bit character string in the specified font or the font contained in the specified GC. This function queries the X server and, therefore, suffer the round-trip overhead that is avoided by XTextExtents(). The function returns a XCharStruct structure, whose members are set to the values as follows.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
Specifies either the font ID or the graphics context ID that contains the font.
The [] text to measure.
The length of the text to measure.
The direction hint (FontLeftToRight or FontRightToLeft).
The font ascent.
The font descent.
The overall size stored in the specified XCharStruct structure.
member.remarks: The ascent member is set to the maximum of the ascent metrics of all characters in the string. The descent member is set to the maximum of the descent metrics. The width member is set to the sum of the character-width metrics of all characters in the string. For each character in the string, let W be the sum of the character-width metrics of all characters preceding it in the string. Let L be the left-side-bearing metric of the character plus W. Let R be the right-side-bearing metric of the character plus W. The lbearing member is set to the minimum L of all characters in the string. The rbearing member is set to the maximum R. For fonts defined with linear indexing rather than 2-byte matrix indexing, each XChar2b structure is interpreted as a 16-bit number with byte1 as the most-significant byte. If the font has no defined default character, undefined characters in the string are taken to have all zero metrics. Characters with all zero metrics are ignored. If the font has no defined default_char, the undefined characters in the string are also ignored.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XQueryTextExtents16(System.IntPtr,X11.XID,X11.XChar2b[],X11.TInt,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@,X11.XCharStruct@)

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XOpenIM(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open an input method, matching the current locale and modifiers specification. Current locale and modifiers are bound to the input method at opening time. The locale associated with an input method cannot be changed dynamically. This implies that the strings returned by XmbLookupString or XwcLookupString, for any input context affiliated with a given input method will be encoded in the locale current at the time the input method is opened. XOpenIM will identify a default input method corresponding to the current locale. That default can be modified using XSetLocaleModifiers for the input method modifier.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
Specifies a pointer to the resource database.
Specifies the full resource name of the application.
Specifies the full class name of the application.
member.returns: The input method on success, or IntPrt.Zero otherwise.
member.remarks: The resourceDb argument is the resource database to be used by the input method for looking up resources that are private to the input method. It is not intended that this database be used to look up values that can be set as IC values in an input context. If db is NULL, no database is passed to the input method.

The resName and resClass arguments specify the resource name and class of the application. They are intended to be used as prefixes by the input method when looking up resources that are common to all input contexts that may be created for this input method. The characters used for resource names and classes must be in the X Portable Character Set. The resources looked up are not fully specified if resName or resClass is IntPrt.Zero.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XSetICFocus(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allow a client to notify an input method that the focus window attached to the specified input context has received keyboard focus. The input method should take action to provide appropriate feedback. Complete feedback specification is a matter of user interface policy. Calling XSetICFocus does not affect the focus window value.
member.param: The input contect to set the focus for.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XUnsetICFocus(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allow a client to notify an input method that the specified input context has lost the keyboard focus and that no more input is expected on the focus window attached to that input context. The input method should take action to provide appropriate feedback. Complete feedback specification is a matter of user interface policy. Calling XUnsetICFocus does not affect the focus window value; the client may still receive events from the input method that are directed to the focus window.
member.param: The input contect to unset the focus for.

The pattern string can contain any characters, but each asterisk (*) is a wildcard for any number of characters, and each question mark (?) is a wildcard for a single character.

member.returns: The requested list of font names on success, or IntPtr.Zero otherwise.
member.remarks: Each returned string is null-terminated. The client should call XFreeFontNames() when finished with the result to free the memory.

White space immediately on either side of a separating comma is ignored.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.XQueryExtension(System.IntPtr,System.String,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@,X11.TInt@)
member.summary: Determine whether the named extension is present.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The extension name.
The major opcode for the indicated extension on success, or zero otherwise. Any minor opcode and the request formats are specific to the extension.
If the extension involves additional event types, the base event type code on success, or zero otherwise. The format of the events is specific to the extension.T
If the extension involves additional error codes, the base error code on success, or zero otherwise. The format of additional data in the errors is specific to the extension.
member.returns: True if the indicated extension is not present, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.setlocale(X11.TInt,X11.TChar[])
member.summary: This function is used to set or query the program's current locale.
member.param: Determine which parts of the program's current locale should be modified.
The [] parts of the program's current locale to be set.
member.returns: The current (new) locale on success, or IntPtr.Zero on a wrong/unsupported 'locale' string. The return string is owned by the runtime library - DO NOT FREE OR MANIPULATE it.
member.remarks: The effects, a locale has: - What multibyte character sequences are valid, and how they are interpreted. - Classification of which characters in the local character set are considered alphabetic, and upper- and lower-case conversion conventions. - The collating sequence for the local language and character set (see section Collation Functions). - Formatting of numbers and currency amounts. - Formatting of dates and times (see section Formatting Date and Time). - What language to use for output, including error messages. (The C library doesn't yet help you implement this.) - What language to use for user answers to yes-or-no questions. - What language to use for more complex user input. (The C library doesn't yet help you implement this.) See 'http://www.cs.utah.edu/dept/old/texinfo/glibc-manual-0.02/library_7.html' for details.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.malloc(X11.TUint,X11.TUint)
member.summary: Allocate unused space for an object whose size in bytes is specified by size and whose value is unspecified. The order and contiguity of storage allocated by successive calls to malloc() is unspecified.
member.param: The number of elements to allocate an array for.
The size of the object to allocate space for in bytes.
member.returns: Upon successful completion with size not equal to 0, malloc() shall return a pointer to the allocated space. If size is 0, either a null pointer or a unique pointer that can be successfully passed to free() shall be returned. Otherwise, it shall return a null pointer and set *** errno *** to indicate the error.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.calloc(X11.TUint,X11.TUint)
member.summary: Allocate unused space for an array of nelem elements each of whose size in bytes is elsize. The space shall be initialized to all bits 0. The order and contiguity of storage allocated by successive calls to calloc() is unspecified.
member.param: The number of elements to allocate an array for.
The size of any element to allocate an array for in bytes.
member.returns: Upon successful completion with both nelem and elsize non-zero, calloc() shall return a pointer to the allocated space. If either nelem or elsize is 0, then either a null pointer or a unique pointer value that can be successfully passed to free() shall be returned. Otherwise, it shall return a null pointer and set *** errno *** to indicate the error.

member.name: M:X11.X11lib.free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees the space pointed to by pointer to be deallocated; that is, made available for further allocation. If pointer is a null pointer, no action shall occur.
member.param: The pointer to the space to deallocate.

member.name: T:X11.XGCJoinStyle
member.summary: The join-style defines how corners are drawn for wide lines.
member.remarks: See: http://www.sbin.org/doc/Xlib/chapt_05.html

member.name: F:X11.XGCJoinStyle.JoinMiter
member.summary: The outer edges of two lines extend to meet at an angle. However, if the angle is less than 11 degrees, then a JoinBevel join-style is used instead.
member.remarks: END of two joined lines with 4px width and 45 angle ##########################/ ######################/XX #################/XXXX #############/XXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX

member.name: F:X11.XGCJoinStyle.JoinRound
member.summary: The corner is a circular arc with the diameter equal to the line-width, centered on the joinpoint.
member.remarks: END of two joined lines with 4px width and 45 angle ############## ##############XX ##############XXXX #############XXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX

member.name: F:X11.XGCJoinStyle.JoinBevel
member.summary: The corner has CapButt endpoint styles with the triangular notch filled.
member.remarks: END of two joined lines with 4px width and 45 angle #########\ ###########\ ############X\ ############XXX\ XXXXXXX\ XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX

member.name: T:X11.XGCLineStyle
member.summary: The line-style defines which sections of a line are drawn.
member.remarks: See: http://www.sbin.org/doc/Xlib/chapt_05.html

member.name: F:X11.XGCLineStyle.LineSolid
member.summary: The full path of the line is drawn.

member.name: F:X11.XGCLineStyle.LineOnOffDash
member.summary: Only the even dashes are drawn, and cap-style applies to all internal ends of the individual dashes, except CapNotLast is treated as CapButt.

member.name: F:X11.XGCLineStyle.LineDoubleDash
member.summary: The full path of the line is drawn, but the even dashes are filled differently than the odd dashes (see fill-style) with CapButt style used where even and odd dashes meet. Typically the dashes are drawn with the foreground pixel value, gaps are drawn with the background pixel values.

member.name: T:X11.XGCFunction
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the possible raster operations.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXclear
member.summary: The result is always 0, independent from src and dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXand
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of src AND dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXandReverse
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of src AND NOT dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXcopy
member.summary: The result is identical to the src.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXandInverted
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of NOT src AND dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXnoop
member.summary: The result is identical to the dst/leaves the target unchanged.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXxor
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of src XOR dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXor
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of src OR dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXnor
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of NOT src AND NOT dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXequiv
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of NOT src XOR dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXinvert
member.summary: The result is the logical calculation NOT dst, means invertation of dst values.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXorReverse
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of src OR NOT dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXcopyInverted
member.summary: The result is the logical calculation NOT src, means invertation of src values.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXorInverted
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of NOT src OR dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXnand
member.summary: The result is the logical combination of NOT src OR NOT dst.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFunction.GXset
member.summary: The result is always 1, independent from src and dst.

member.name: T:X11.XGCFillStyle
member.summary: Specify how to fill text and polygon [e.g. by XDrawText(), XDrawText16(), XFillRectangle(), XFillPolygon(), and XFillArc()], how to draw lines [e.g. with XDrawLine(), XDrawSegments(), XDrawRectangle(), XDrawArc()] and to draw even dashes of a dashed line [with line-style LineOnOffDash, LineDoubleDash].

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillStyle.FillSolid
member.summary: Fill with the foreground color.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillStyle.FillTiled
member.summary: Fill with a tile bitmap.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillStyle.FillStippled
member.summary: Fill with foreground masked by stipple.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillStyle.FillOpaqueStippled
member.summary: Fill with a tile bitmap with the same width and height as stipple, but with background everywhere stipple has a zero and with foreground everywhere stipple has a one.

member.name: T:X11.XGCCapStyle
member.summary: The cap-style defines how the endpoints of a path are drawn.
member.remarks: See: http://www.sbin.org/doc/Xlib/chapt_05.html

member.name: F:X11.XGCCapStyle.CapNotLast
member.summary: This is equivalent to CapButt except that for a line-width of zero the final endpoint is not drawn.

member.name: F:X11.XGCCapStyle.CapButt
member.summary: The line is square at the endpoint (perpendicular to the slope of the line) with no projection beyond.

member.name: F:X11.XGCCapStyle.CapRound
member.summary: The line has a circular arc with the diameter equal to the line-width, centered on the endpoint. (This is equivalent to CapButt for line-width of zero).

member.name: F:X11.XGCCapStyle.CapProjecting
member.summary: The line is square at the end, but the path continues beyond the endpoint for a distance equal to half the line-width. (This is equivalent to CapButt for line-width of zero).

member.name: T:X11.XGCFillRule
member.summary: Define what pixels are inside a path to draw.
member.remarks: The fill-rule defines what pixels are inside (drawn) for paths given in XFillPolygon() requests and can be set to EvenOddRule or WindingRule.
See: http://www.sbin.org/doc/Xlib/chapt_05.html

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillRule.EvenOddRule
member.summary: For EvenOddRule, a point is inside if an infinite ray with the point as origin crosses the path an odd number of times.

member.name: F:X11.XGCFillRule.WindingRule
member.summary: For WindingRule, a point is inside if an infinite ray with the point as origin crosses an unequal number of clockwise and counterclockwise directed path segments.

member.summary: Copy the window class data from parent window.

member.summary: Identify a window class, that cannot be used as a drawable (act as a source or destination for graphics requests).

member.summary: Identify a window class, that can be used as a drawable.

member.summary: Define, that XCreateColorMap() doesn't allocate color entries.

member.remarks: Not applicable for StaticGray, StaticColor, and TrueColor visuals.

member.name: M:X11.XColorNames.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Determine the color map index if the indicatewd color name.
member.param: The color name to determine the index for.
member.returns: The color map index on success, or -1 otherwise.

member.name: F:X11.XColorNames.ColorMap
member.summary: The color map of known color names.

member.name: T:X11.TColor
member.summary: Define a value type to support legacy X11 drawing (using TPixel) and newer APIs (using RGB).
member.remarks: Keep behaviour and interface an near to System.Drawing.Color as possible.

member.name: F:X11.TColor._pixel
member.summary: The X11 color pixel, suitable for the current color model (for legacy drawing).

member.name: F:X11.TColor._pixelInited
member.summary: Determine whether the pixel value has been initialized.

member.name: F:X11.TColor._alpha
member.summary: The alpha channel (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).
member.remarks: A value of 0 means completely transparent, a value of 255 means completely opaque.

member.name: F:X11.TColor._red
member.summary: The red color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

member.name: F:X11.TColor._green
member.summary: The green color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

member.name: F:X11.TColor._blue
member.summary: The blue color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

The blue color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

member.name: M:X11.TColor.FromARGB(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)

member.param: The color transparency component (0 = fully transparent, 256 = fully opaque).
The red color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

The blue color component (for advanced drawing with GL or Cairo).

member.name: M:X11.TColor.FromARGB(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initialize a new X11.TColor instance without alpha value (transparency) and without pixel value (must be initialized at first utilization).
member.param: The alpha, red, green and blue color component .
member.returns: The color.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.FromRGB(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Initialize a new X11.TColor instance without alpha value (transparency) and without pixel value (must be initialized at first utilization).
member.param: The red color component.
The green color component.
The blue color component.
member.returns: The color.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.FromRGB(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new X11.TColor instance without alpha value (transparency) and without pixel value (must be initialized at first utilization).
member.param: The red, green and blue color component .
member.returns: The color.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.FromName(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new X11.TColor instance with alpha value (transparency) but without pixel value (must be initialized at first utilization).
member.param: The color name to initialize the color.
member.returns: The color.
member.remarks: The 'colorName' must either be a HTML color name (with syntax #RGB, #RRGGBB, #AARRGGBB) or a known color name (e. g. 'Red').

member.name: M:X11.TColor.BytesFromARGB(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a hexadecimal string of 3, 4, 6 or 8 characters length to a byte array of color components A, R, G and B.
member.param: The hexadecimal string of 3, 4, 6 or 8 characters length to parse.
member.returns: The color on success, or a color with fallback values A=255, R=0, G=0 and B=0 for unparsable color components.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.Equals(X11.TColor)
member.summary: Determine whether the current instance of color and a specified color have the same value.
member.param: The color to compare with the current instance of color.
member.returns: Returns true on equality, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determine whether the value of the specified object is equivalent to the current instance of .
member.param: The to compare with the current instance of .
member.returns: Return true on equality or false otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compare the current instance of color with a specified object, which must also be a color, and indicate whether this instance of color precedes, follows, or appears in the same position in the sort order as the specified color.
member.param: The color to compare with the current instance of color.
member.returns: -1 if the current instance of color is is less than the color to compare to, 1 if the current instance of color is greater than the color to compare to or 0 if the current instance of color is equal to the color to compare to.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.CompareTo(X11.TColor)
member.summary: Compares the current instance of color with a specified color and indicate whether this instance of color precedes, follows, or appears in the same position in the sort order as the specified color.
member.param: The color to compare with the current instance of color.
member.returns: -1 if the current instance of color is is less than the color to compare to, 1 if the current instance of color is greater than the color to compare to or 0 if the current instance of color is equal to the color to compare to.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.GetHashCode
member.summary: Retrieve the hash code for this structure.
member.returns: A 32-bit hash code, which is a signed integer.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.op_Equality(X11.TColor,X11.TColor)

The second color to compare.
member.returns: True on equality, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.TColor.op_Inequality(X11.TColor,X11.TColor)
member.summary: Evaluates two colors to determine inequality.

member.name: T:X11.XStateMask

member.remarks: The state member is set to indicate the logical state of the pointer buttons and modifier keys just prior to the event, which is the bitwise inclusive OR of one or more of the button or modifier key masks. See also .

member.name: T:X11.XRevertTo
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the flags, that define the fallback behaviour for XGetInputFocus() and XSetInputFocus() calls.

member.name: F:X11.XRevertTo.RevertToNone
member.summary: If focus window gets not viewable, the X server passes focus to none (keyboard events are discarded).

member.name: F:X11.XRevertTo.RevertToPointerRoot
member.summary: If focus window gets not viewable, the X server passes focus to the pointer root.

member.name: F:X11.XRevertTo.RevertToParent
member.summary: If focus window gets not viewable, the X server passes focus to the parent (or the closest viewable ancestor).

member.name: T:X11.XImageFormat
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the image format or XCreateImage() calls.

member.name: F:X11.XImageFormat.XYBitmap
member.summary: Single plane (image depth 1) bitmap.

member.name: F:X11.XImageFormat.XYPixmap
member.summary: Multi plane (image depth must match the depth of the target drawable) pixmap.
member.remarks: The pixmap pixels are organized as a set of bitmaps in planes representing individual bit planes. With the planes appearing from most-significant to least-significant in bit order. Which means for an RGB image - all the red channel data followed by the green and then blue.

member.name: F:X11.XImageFormat.ZPixmap
member.summary: Multi plane (image depth must match the depth of the target drawable) pixmap.
member.remarks: The pixmap pixels are organized as a set of RGB triplets.

member.name: M:X11.XChar2b.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance of XChar2b with a specified object, which must also be a XChar2b, and indicate whether this instance of XChar2b precedes, follows, or appears in the same position in the sort order as the specified XChar2b.
member.param: The XChar2b to compare with the current instance of string.
member.returns: -1 if the current instance of XChar2b is is less than the XChar2b to compare to, 1 if the current instance of XChar2b is greater than the XChar2b to compare to or 0 if the current instance of XChar2b is equal to the XChar2b to compare to.

member.name: M:X11.XChar2b.CompareTo(X11.XChar2b)

member.param: The XChar2b to compare with the current instance of XChar2b.
member.returns: -1 if the current instance of XChar2b is is less than the XChar2b to compare to, 1 if the current instance of XChar2b is greater than the XChar2b to compare to or 0 if the current instance of XChar2b is equal to the XChar2b to compare to.

member.name: T:X11.XClipRectanglesOrdering
member.summary: The enumeration defines the possible ordering relations on the rectangles.

member.name: F:X11.XClipRectanglesOrdering.Unsorted
member.summary: The rectangles are in arbitrary order.

member.name: F:X11.XClipRectanglesOrdering.YSorted
member.summary: The rectangles are nondecreasing in their Y origin.

member.name: F:X11.XClipRectanglesOrdering.YXSorted
member.summary: The rectangles are nondecreasing in their Y origin and additionally all rectangles with an equal Y origin are nondecreasing in their X origin.

member.name: F:X11.XClipRectanglesOrdering.YXBanded
member.summary: Additionally to YXSorted, for every possible Y scanline, all rectangles that include that scanline have an identical Y origins and Y extents.

member.name: T:X11.XFontSetExtents
member.summary: The structure provides access to the maximum character extents for the fonts that are used by the text drawing layers.

member.name: F:X11.XFontSetExtents.max_ink_extent
member.summary: The maximum extent, over all drawable characters, of the rectangles that bound the character glyph image drawn in the foreground color, relative to a constant origin.

member.name: F:X11.XFontSetExtents.max_logical_extent
member.summary: The maximum extent, over all drawable characters, of the rectangles that specify minimum spacing to other graphical features, relative to a constant origin.
member.remarks: Other graphical features drawn by the client, for example, a border surrounding the text, should not intersect this rectangle. The max_logical_extent member should be used to compute minimum interline spacing and the minimum area that must be allowed in a text field to draw a given number of arbitrary characters.

member.name: T:X11.XGravity
member.summary: The bit gravity of a window defines which region of the window should be retained when an InputOutput window is resized.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.ForgetGravity
member.summary: Only relevant for bit gravity. Indicates that the window's contents are always discarded after a size change, even if a backing store or save under has been requested.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.UnmapGravity
member.summary: Like NorthWestGravity (the window is not moved), except the child is also unmapped when the parent is resized, and an UnmapNotify event is generated.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.NorthWestGravity
member.summary: The gravity with the coordinates 0, 0.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.NorthGravity
member.summary: The gravity with the coordinates Width/2, 0.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.NorthEastGravity
member.summary: The gravity with the coordinates Width, 0.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.WestGravity
member.summary: The gravity with the coordinates 0, Height/2.

member.name: F:X11.XGravity.CenterGravity
member.summary: The gravity with the coordinates Width/2, Height/2.

member.summary: Puffer clipboard data between the time of ProvideClipboardText() call and the request for clipboard data.

member.summary: Register ClipboardGetResult event handler.

member.name: P:X11.X11Clipboard.TreatClipboardResultDelegate
member.summary: Get the prototype the delegate, that processes the clipboard request result.
member.value: The prototype the delegate, that processes the clipboard request result.
member.remarks: The processing of the clipboard request result (typically an UTF8_STRING) must be postponed until the complete communication procedure between clipboard owner (tapically a foreign application) and clipboard requestor (always this application) is finished. This includes 2x2 events at least, that have to be exchanged between clipboard requestor and clipboard owner.

members.member: Legacy X11 compatible method. Provides clipboard data hosted by the widget, that originally owns the data, to any requestor. **Register as data provider for clipboard interaction. The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.The drawable pointer, that specifies the window to register as data provider for clipboard interaction.The selection atom, that defines the selection buffer to use. Predefined are CLIPBOARD, PRIMARY and SECONDARY.The time the event (typical mouse or button) occurs, that triggers this clipboard interaction.The data to provide to the clipboard.True on success, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:X11.X11Clipboard.RequestClipboardTypes(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,X11.TTime)
member.summary: Ask the clipboard selection owner for supported formats.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable pointer, that specifies the window to ask for supported formats.
The selection atom, that defines the selection buffer to use. Predefined are CLIPBOARD, PRIMARY and SECONDARY.
The target atom, that defines the requested format.
The property atom, that identifies the data buffer for data transfer.
The time the event (typical mouse or button) occurs, that triggers this clipboard interaction.

member.summary: Ask the clipboard selection owner for STRING (plain text) data.
member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable pointer, that specifies the window to ask for STRING (plain text) data.
The [] of selection atoms, that define the possible selection buffer to use. Predefined are CLIPBOARD, PRIMARY and SECONDARY.
The selection atom, that defines the selection buffer to use. Predefined are CLIPBOARD, PRIMARY and SECONDARY.
member.returns: Returns the selection owner.

member.param: The display pointer, that specifies the connection to the X server.
The drawable pointer, that specifies the window to ask for STRING (plain text) data.
The [] of selection atoms, that define the possible selection buffer to use. Predefined are CLIPBOARD, PRIMARY and SECONDARY.
The target atom, that defines the requested format.
The property atom, that identifies the data buffer for data transfer.
The time the event (typical mouse or button) occurs, that triggers this clipboard interaction.
